For data to appear on the Business Value Dashboard, the cost of the failure must be set at the report level.

item.title: View the Construction Page in Construct
item.description: View the Construction Page in Construct In Construct, view the page created when a {Full Construction} Target Source is saved in Target Design. To view the page in Construct: Click Objects on the Construct Launch page. Click the Targets icon for an Object. Click the Construct Pages icon for the Target. NOTE: The page that opens displays information about all of the construct pages that have been created for the Target.

item.title: View the Controls Available For A Page Type
item.description: View the Controls Available For A Page Type The controls that can be defined in column properties or a page are dependent on the page’s page type. For example, a tab control is allowed on Dynamic pages, but not on a Chart page. When a user designs a page with a page type of Chart, the *Page Column’*s page’s Vertical View displays only those fields relevant to the chart page’s allowable control types.

item.title: View the Dashboard in Construct
item.description: View the Dashboard in Construct These charts display the summary status of the number of fields in the Source table, the estimated number of fields that require construction (as in, active fields for the Target) and the number of fields where construction is complete. A user can drill down from the Wave level through the Wave and Process Area, Object, and Target level to view a summary construction status at increasingly granular levels.

item.title: View the Dashboard in dspTrack™
item.description: View the Dashboard in dspTrack™ The dspTrack™ dashboard provides an overview of the status of projects, plans, and tasks. NOTE: Charts display data from active plans only. Refer to Activate and Deactivate a Plan for more information. NOTE: Information about Work List Items is not displayed in the dashboard as Work List Items are not assigned to projects and plans. The data on the dashboard displays based on a user’s security settings.

item.title: View the Debug Log
item.description: View the Debug Log To assist in troubleshooting, access the Debug Log for Integrate in the Common component. Refer to Configure Debug Log Settings for more information.

item.title: View the Debug Log for dspTrack™
item.description: View the Debug Log for dspTrack™ Errors encountered when importing or exporting data from dspTrack™ are logged on the debug log accessible in Common. To assist in troubleshooting, view the log by selecting Common > Job Monitor > Debug Logs > View Debug Logs for dspTrack™. Refer to Monitor Application Activity for more information about viewing activity, configuring debug logs settings and deleting monitored records.

item.title: View the Profiling Results
item.description: View the Profiling Results To view the profiling results: Select Common > Analyze > Data Services Profiling Results in the Navigation pane. Select the DATASTORE_ID to view the results in the Data Services Profile Results Table Columns page. To see the list of distinct values and distinct patterns click the DISTINCT_COUNT or PATTERN_COUNT respectively.

item.title: View the Report User Access Dashboard
item.description: View the Report User Access Dashboard This dashboard displays the reports accessed by all users. There is no retention date established. To access the Report User Access Dashboard in Transform, select Tracking > Report User Access Dashboard in the Navigation pane. The Report Access (By Report, By User) page and Access Chart (By Report By User) display. Selecting a report on the Report Access (By Report, By User) page displays the chart in the child pane - Access Chart (By Report By User) which displays the number of views of a report by a user by day (the date(s) and time(s) the selected report was accessed).

item.title: View the Report User Access Log
item.description: View the Report User Access Log This page displays all users accessing any reports to which they are assigned. There are no filters set (date, time, etc.). The data is never deleted; there is no established retention date. To access the Report User Access Dashboard in Transform, select Tracking > Report User Access Log in the Navigation pane.

item.title: View the Reports - Never Viewed
item.description: View the Reports - Never Viewed This page displays the reports that have never been viewed by anyone. A report remains on the list until it is viewed. To access the Report User Access Dashboard in Transform, select Tracking > Reports – Never Viewed in the Navigation pane.

item.title: View the Reports - Updated Not Viewed (By User)
item.description: View the Reports - Updated Not Viewed (By User) This page displays the reports that have been previously updated and published by the current user but have not been accessed/viewed since the most recent publishing. To access the Report User Access Dashboard in Transform, select Tracking > Reports – Updated Not Viewed (By User)in the Navigation pane.

item.title: View the Request Details Diagram
item.description: View the Request Details Diagram A Role Processor can view a visual representation of an active request’s process through the workflow, including which roles have been completed for the request. The diagram displays: The Request ID The request status for the request selected on the Request page The scenario to which the request belongs Related requests in the scenario and their status The roles in the scenario The status of each role The tasks assigned to each role Whether a role is finished and whether dependencies are complete Hover a cursor over a node to view details.

item.title: View the Request Objects Creation Log
item.description: View the Request Objects Creation Log This log displays all the log records that are written when the stored procedures registered to Build Objects execute as the Request-related objects are created. There are two ways to access the log. To access the log at any time: Click Design in the Navigation pane. Click Vertical View for a category. Click the Rules and Actions tab. Click the Request Table and Views Creation Log icon.

item.title: View the Roles and Tasks Assigned to a Scenario
item.description: View the Roles and Tasks Assigned to a Scenario A Designer can view the roles and tasks that use a scenario to evaluate overall business process design and how updates to a scenario may affect other elements that are assigned to that scenario. To view a diagram illustrating the relationships between the selected scenario and all roles and tasks assigned: Click dspConduct > Design in the Navigation pane. Click the Scenarios icon for a category.

item.title: View the Source Tables and Fields Mapped to a Lookup Table
item.description: View the Source Tables and Fields Mapped to a Lookup Table A user can access the Source Value Tracking page to view each Source table that has a field that has been mapped to the lookup table selected on the Value Mapping (Sources) page. For example, numerous fields use the table T006 to value map unit of measure. This page allows the user to see which Targets, Sources, and fields are entering values into T006.

item.title: View the WebApp Groups and WebApp Pages that a User can Access
item.description: View the WebApp Groups and WebApp Pages that a User can Access WebApp groups define authorization or access on a page by page basis. When a user is assigned to a WebApp group, that group controls which pages the user can access. Page rights override WebApp group rights. For example, if the WebApp group permits deletion on a page, but the page security restricts it, users assigned to the WebApp group are unable to delete records from the page.

item.title: View the Workflow Log
item.description: View the Workflow Log Each time the DSP® sends a workflow message to a user, it is recorded in the workflow log. The log displays information that can assist in troubleshooting such as whether the workflow was sent successfully, when the workflow was sent, and who received (or should have received) the message. Workflow settings for delivered components are configured from within a component. Workflows are sent from dspTrack™, dspMonitor™, dspCompose™, dspConduct™, ISA, and Collect.

item.title: View where Plugin is Used within the DSP
item.description: View where Plugin is Used within the DSP When the plugin assembly is registered in the DSP, all plugins within the assembly are automatically brought into the DSP. Users can view the pages within the DSP where the plugins are registered as business rules, validation rules and list data providers (as in, instances where a plugin is used to determine what is displayed in a list box on a DSP page).

item.title: Warn Thresholds
item.description: Warn Thresholds Thresholds can be set around the start or end of work on a task. Pre Start Warn and Post Start Warn Thresholds If work has not started on a task (the task is in Ready or Waiting on Dependency status), the Pre Start Warn Threshold marks the point in time prior to the planned start date that the task’s schedule status is behind and its Schedule Status icon becomes yellow.

item.title: Wave & Process Area Source Rules: Mapping Status
item.description: Wave & Process Area Source Rules: Mapping Status This chart displays the mapping status (in process or complete) of all source rules for all Objects in the Wave and Process Area selected in the Context bar. Hover a cursor over a section of a chart to view the count of mappings for that status. Click the bar to drill down to the Object Source Rules: Mapping Status chart. Refer to View Dashboards in Map for general information about chart features.

item.title: Wave & Process Area Source Rules: Rule Status
item.description: Wave & Process Area Source Rules: Rule Status This chart displays the rule status (in process or complete) of all Source rules for all Objects in the Wave and Process Area selected in the Context bar. Hover a cursor over a section of a chart to view the count of mappings for that status. Click the bar to drill down to the Object Source Rules: Rule Status chart. Refer to View Dashboards in Map for general information about chart features.

item.title: Wave & Process Area Target Rules: Rule Status
item.description: Wave & Process Area Target Rules: Rule Status This chart displays the rule status (in process or complete) of all Target rules for all Objects in the Wave and Process Area selected in the Context bar. Hover a cursor over a section of a chart to view the count of mappings for that status. Click the bar to drill down to the Object Target Rules: Rule Status chart. Refer to View Dashboards in Map for general information about chart features.

item.title: Wave & Process Area Target Rules: Mapping Status
item.description: Wave & Process Area Target Rules: Mapping Status This chart displays the mapping status (in process or complete) of all Target rules for all Objects in the Wave and Process Area selected in the Context bar. Hover a cursor over a section of a chart to view the count of mappings for that status. Click the bar to drill down to the Object Target Rules: Mapping Status chart. Refer to View Dashboards in Map for general information about chart features.

item.title: Wave Compare for Object Results H
item.description: Wave Compare for Object Results H Wave Compare for Object Results V Use this page to [Synchronize Target Designs Across Waves](../Use_Cases/Synchronize_Target_Designs_Across_Waves). NOTE: This page is only accessible if the current user is a member of the WebApp group WaveSynchronizer in Console or is assigned to a security role with access to the page. Refer to Set Security in System Administration for more information. To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane, or select Console in the Context bar.

item.title: Wave Compare for Process Area Results H
item.description: Wave Compare for Process Area Results H Wave Compare for Process Area Results V Use this page to [Synchronize Target Designs Across Waves](../Use_Cases/Synchronize_Target_Designs_Across_Waves). NOTE: This page is only accessible if the current user is a member of the WebApp group WaveSynchronizer in Console or is assigned to a security role with access to the page. Refer to Set Security in System Administration for more information. To access this page:

item.title: Wave Compare for Target Field Results H
item.description: Wave Compare for Target Field Results H Wave Compare for Target Field Results V Use this page to [Synchronize Target Designs Across Waves](../Use_Cases/Synchronize_Target_Designs_Across_Waves). NOTE: This page is only accessible if the current user is a member of the WebApp group Wavesynchronizer in Console or is assigned to a security role with access to the page. Refer to Set Security in System Administration for more information. To access this page:

item.title: Wave Compare for Target Results H
item.description: Wave Compare for Target Results H Wave Compare for Target Results V Use this page to [Synchronize Target Designs Across Waves](../Use_Cases/Synchronize_Target_Designs_Across_Waves). NOTE: This page is only accessible if the current user is a member of the WebApp group WaveSynchronizer in Console or is assigned to a security role with access to the page. Refer to Set Security in System Administration for more information. To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane, or select Console in the Context bar.

item.title: Wave Gate Metrics (Value Mapping) H
item.description: Wave Gate Metrics (Value Mapping) H Wave Gate Metrics (Value Mapping) V Use this page to [Set up Wave Gate Metrics for Map](../Use_Cases/Evaluate_Mapping_with_Wave_Gate_Metrics). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane, or select Console in the Context bar. Click Waves in the Navigation pane. Click the Metrics icon for a Wave. Field Description NAME Displays the Wave name.

item.title: Wave Gate Metrics (Value Mapping) H
item.description: Wave Gate Metrics (Value Mapping) H Wave Gate Metrics (Value Mapping) V Use this page to [View Metrics](../Use_Cases/View_Metrics_Map). To access this page: Click dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Click Map in the Context bar. Click the Metrics icon on the Process Area Launch page. Click the Gate Value Mapping icon on the Metrics and Reports Landing page. Field Description NAME Displays the Wave name.

item.title: Wave Identification H
item.description: Wave Identification H Wave Identification V Use this page to [Configure the Migration dashboard](../Use_Cases/Configure_the_Migration_Dashboard). To access this page, select Agent Interface > Dashboards > Migration Dashboard in the Navigation pane. Field Description WAVE ID Displays the name of the active wave. Click the wave name to open the Waves page for that wave in Console. SEND WAVE AND MILESTONE METRICS

item.title: Wave Lookup Table Refresh
item.description: Wave Lookup Table Refresh Use this page to [Refresh Target and Legacy Values](../Use_Cases/Refresh_Target_and_Legacy_Values). To access this page: Click dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Click Map in the Context bar. Select Configuration > Wave Lookup Table Refresh in Navigation pane. Field Description Refresh Target Values Click to refresh values into check tables. Refresh Legacy Values Click to refresh Legacy Source tables and fields marked as active for the Source and the Source field.

item.title: Wave Milestones H
item.description: Wave Milestones H Wave Milestones V Use this page to [Configure the IGC Migration dashboard](../Use_Cases/Configure_the_Migration_Dashboard). To access this page: Select Agent Interface > Dashboards > Migration Dashboard in the Navigation pane. Click the Milestones icon for a wave. Field Description NAME Displays the name of the milestone. ABBREVIATION Displays a four-character abbreviation of the milestone name that displays on the Migration dashboard.

item.title: Wave Process Area Gate Metrics (Field Mapping) H
item.description: Wave Process Area Gate Metrics (Field Mapping) H Wave Process Area Gate Metrics (Field Mapping) V Use this page to [Set up Wave Gate Metrics for Map](../Use_Cases/Evaluate_Mapping_with_Wave_Gate_Metrics). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane, or select Console in the Context bar. Click Waves in the Navigation pane. Click the Process Areas icon for a Wave. Click the Metrics icon for a Process Area. Field

item.title: Wave Process Area Gate Metrics (Field Mapping) H
item.description: Wave Process Area Gate Metrics (Field Mapping) H Wave Process Area Gate Metrics (Field Mapping) V Use this page to [View Metrics](../Use_Cases/View_Metrics_Map). To access this page: Click dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Click Map in the Context bar. Click the Metrics icon on the Process Area Launch page. Click theGate Field Mapping icon on the Metrics and Reports Landing page. Field Description GATE NAME

item.title: Wave and Process Area Summary Value Mapping Dashboard
item.description: Wave and Process Area Summary Value Mapping Dashboard In value mapping, an individual value in a Source field is configured to be converted to a value that the Target system accepts in the Target field. For example, the Source system may store USA in the Country field, while the Target system uses the value US. Value mapping converts the Source value to the Target value for every occurrence of the Source value in the field.

item.title: Wave: Process Areas H
item.description: Wave: Process Areas H Wave: Process Areas V Use this page to [Create the Contexts for Migration Projects.](../Use_Cases/Create_Contexts_for_Migration_Projects) To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane, or select Console in the Context bar. Click Waves in the Navigation pane. Click the Process Areas icon for a Wave. Field Description Create Milestones From Template This icon will be used in a future release.

item.title: Waves H
item.description: Waves H Waves V Use this page to [Create the Contexts for Migration Projects.](../Use_Cases/Create_Contexts_for_Migration_Projects) To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane, or select Console in the Context bar. Click Waves in the Navigation pane. Field Description Copy Wave Click to open the Copy Wave page to create a Wave based on the selected Wave. Create Milestones From Template

item.title: WebApp (Users)
item.description: WebApp (Users) Use this page to: - [Assign Users to a WebApp for Custom Application Development/Customizations](../Use_Cases/AssignUsersWebAppCustomAppDev.htm) - [Grant Users Access to Post Monitor Group in Integrate](../Use_Cases/Grant_Users_Access_to_Post_Monitor_Group_in_Integrate_in_System_Administration.htm) - [Assign Users to WebApp Groups](../Use_Cases/Assign_Users_to_WebApp_Groups.htm) To access this page: Select Admin > Security > WebApp Security in the Navigation pane. Click the Users icon for the WebApp. Field Description USER ID Displays ID associated with the user used to log in to the Platform.

item.title: WebApp Catalogs H
item.description: WebApp Catalogs H WebApp Catalogs V Use this page to [Assign a Catalog to a Custom WebApp](../Use_Cases/Assign%20a%20Catalog%20to%20a%20Custom%20Webapp.htm). To access this page: Select Admin > WebApps on the *Navigation* pane. Click Catalogs for a WEB APP NAME. Field Description PRIORITY Displays the priority of catalogs registered to a webapp. CATALOG ID Displays the catalog to use for translations and help for pages in this webapp.

item.title: WebApp Customization
item.description: WebApp Customization Use this page to: - [Add a Catalog to a Delivered WebApp](../Use_Cases/Add%20a%20Catalog%20to%20a%20Delivered%20WebApp.htm) - [Add Custom Links to a Page](../Use_Cases/Add_a_Custom_Link.htm) - [Customize Dashboard Pages](../../WebApp_Dev/Customize_Dashboard_Pages.htm) To access this page, select Admin > Customization > WebApp Customization in the Navigation pane. Field Description WEB APP NAME Displays the WebApp name where customizations are made. Catalogs Click to open the Catalog Extension page to add, edit and delete catalogs for custom WebApps.

item.title: WebApp Event
item.description: WebApp Event Use this page to [Register WebApp Events](../Use_Cases/Register_WebApp_Events). To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the Events icon. Click the Parameters icon for an event with EVENT TYPE of WebApp. Field Description FIELD Displays the field from the WebApp view that is passed to the event. When the view is registered to the event, the parameters are automatically created for the event.

item.title: WebApp Group Design
item.description: WebApp Group Design When designing an application, the Designer should know the different types of users who will access the application. Some applications are only meant to have a single user who has full access to the features, pages, and functionality that will be put into the application. However, more elaborate and partitioned applications may expect different types of users to have access to certain pages. Refer to Set Security for a Custom WebApp for general information.

item.title: WebApp Group Users
item.description: WebApp Group Users Use this page to [Assign Users to WebApp Groups](../Use_Cases/Assign_Users_to_WebApp_Groups.htm). To access this page: Select to Admin >Security > WebApp Security in the *Navigation* pane. Click Groups for a WEB APP NAME. Click Users. Field Description USER ID Displays ID associated with the user used to log in to the Platform.

item.title: WebApp Groups
item.description: WebApp Groups All WebApps, also known as components, have three basic WebApp groups: PowerUser – Full access to all pages in the component. The creator of a component is automatically added to this group. As a recommendation, add as few users to this WebApp group as possible. When new pages are created for a component, members of this group are automatically added to the PowerUser WebApp group with full page rights.

item.title: WebApp Groups H
item.description: WebApp Groups H WebApp Groups V Use this page to [Create WebApp Groups using the WebApp Groups Page](../Use_Cases/Create_WebApp_Groups_using_the_WebApp_Groups_page.htm). To access this page: Select Admin > Security > WebApp Security in the *Navigation* pane. Click Groups for a WEB APP NAME. Field Description WEB APP NAME Displays name of the WebApp to which the security group belongs.

item.title: WebApp Layout
item.description: WebApp Layout Every WebApp contains pages and every page requires a page definition that represents the core function of the DSP® operation. Pages are based on views in a database. Each page can contain column properties, events and control views as well as additional features depending on the page type.

item.title: WebApp Security
item.description: WebApp Security Use this page to [Assign Users to a WebApp for Custom Application Development/Customizations](../Use_Cases/AssignUsersWebAppCustomAppDev.htm). To access this page: Select Admin >Security > WebApp Security in the *Navigation* pane. Click Users for WebApp. Field Description WEB APP NAME Displays name of the WebApp to which the security group belongs. USERS Click to open the WebApp(Users) page to manage users assigned to the group.

item.title: WebApp Users (Groups)
item.description: WebApp Users (Groups) Use this page to - [Grant Users Access to Post Monitor Group in Integrate](../Use_Cases/Grant_Users_Access_to_Post_Monitor_Group_in_Integrate_in_System_Administration.htm). - [Assign Users to WebApp Groups](../Use_Cases/Assign_Users_to_WebApp_Groups.htm) To access this page, select Admin >WebApps in the *Navigation* pane. Field Description GROUP ID Displays name of the security group where user is assigned. Authorization is determined by security groups. USER NAME Displays name of user associated with the User ID.

item.title: WebApps
item.description: WebApps Use this page to [Customize Security with Custom WebApp Groups Using DSP Add-Ons](Custmize_Security_Cstm_WebAppGrps_DSP_AddOns). To access this page, click DSP Add-Ons in the Navigation pane. Field Description WEB APP NAME Displays the name of the WebApp that contains the WebApp group. DATA SOURCE ID Displays the name of the WebApp’s data source, a database. Web App Groups Click to open the Groups page to add and configure WebApp groups.

item.title: WebApps H
item.description: WebApps H WebApps V Use this page to [Create a WebApp](../../WebApp_Dev/Create_a_WebApp.htm). To access this page, select Admin > WebApps in the *Navigation* pane. Field Description WEB APP NAME Displays the name of the WebApp. DATA SOURCE ID Displays the name of the WebApp’s data source, a database. Pages Click to open the Pages page for the selected WEB APP NAME.

item.title: Weekly Summary By Object
item.description: Weekly Summary By Object This chart displays the number of mappings per status for all field mappings for all targets in the Object selected on the Objects page for the week. The number in the x-axis is the number of the week in the year. For example, 2014-01 is the first week of the year 2014. The Total Mappings is the count of active fields in the target. Hover a cursor over a data point to view the number of field mappings in that status for the Object for that week.

item.title: Weekly Summary By Wave & Process Area
item.description: Weekly Summary By Wave & Process Area This chart displays the number of mappings per status for all field mappings in the Wave and Process Area in the Context bar for the week. The number in the x-axis is the number of the week in the year. For example, 201401 is the first week of the year 2014. The Total Mappings is the count of active fields in the Target.

item.title: When to use Value Columns Instead of a Secondary Column
item.description: When to use Value Columns Instead of a Secondary Column It may seem intuitive to always use a Secondary category when each record represents a separate value because Secondary categories give the best angle to manipulate data. However, Secondary categories do not allow for column properties that the Value columns support, such as coloring individual lines or bars. An example of when to use multiple Value columns instead of a Secondary column would be for data within a finite number of possible states.

item.title: Work Day
item.description: Work Day Use this page to [Set Work Days and Work Hours for a Calendar](../Use_Cases/SetWorkDysHrsCalendar). To access this page: Select Common > Tools > Calendar from the Navigation pane. Click Work Days for a calendar. Field Description Copy Work Hours Click to copy the work hours of the selected work day to all other work days in the calendar.

item.title: Work Hours
item.description: Work Hours Use this page to [Set Work Days and Work Hours for a Calendar](../Use_Cases/SetWorkDysHrsCalendar). To access this page: Select Common > Tools > Calendar from the Navigation pane. Click Work Days for a calendar. Click the Work Hours icon for a work day. Field Description START TIME Displays the start time of a shift on the selected work day.

item.title: Work List Binding Criteria
item.description: Work List Binding Criteria Use this page to [Add Work List Binding Criteria to a Work List Item or Plan Task](../Use_Cases/AddWrkLisBindingCriteriaItem). To access this page: Select Track >Configuration > Work List in the Navigation pane.. Click the Keys icon for an item. Field Description KEY NAME Displays the primary key name(s) for the underlying table for the page selected in the PAGE ID list box on the Work List Set up page.

item.title: Work List Detail
item.description: Work List Detail Use this page to [View Work List Details.](../Use_Cases/View_Work_List_Details) To access this page: Click the blue tab on the Quick Panel to access the Work List. Click Work List Details on the Page Toolbar; all work list details for all Plan Tasks and Work List Items display. Field Description Schedule Status Image Displays an image related to the task’s schedule status, which is calculated by dspTrack™.

item.title: Work List Detail – Resource
item.description: Work List Detail – Resource Use this page while [Viewing Work List Details](../Use_Cases/View_Work_List_Details). To access this page: Click the blue tab on the Quick Panel to access the Work List. Click Work List Details on the Page Toolbar; all work list details for all Plan Tasks and WorkList Items display. Field Description USER ID Displays user assigned to the selected Plan Task or Work List Item.

item.title: Work List Detail – Tag
item.description: Work List Detail – Tag Use this page while [Viewing Work List Details](../Use_Cases/View_Work_List_Details). To access this page: Click the blue tab on the Quick Panel to access the Work List. Click Work List Details on the Page Toolbar; all work list details for all Plan Tasks and Work List Items display. Click the Tags icon. Field Description TAG ID

item.title: Work List Event Rule - Plan Task
item.description: Work List Event Rule - Plan Task Use this page to [Register Work List Event Rules to a Plan Task](../Use_Cases/Register_Work_List_Event_Rules_for_a_Plan_Task). To access this page: Select Track > Project in the *Navigation* pane. Click Plans for a project. Click Tasks for a plan. Click Rules for a task. Field Description PLAN TASK ID Displays the task name associated with the rule.

item.title: Work List Event Rule - Work List Setup
item.description: Work List Event Rule - Work List Setup Use this page to [Register Work List Event Rules for a Work List Item](../Use_Cases/Register_WorkList_Event_Rules_WorkList_Item). To access this page: Select Track > Configuration > Work List in the *Navigation* pane. Click Rules for an item. Field Description WORK LIST ITEM ID Displays the name of Work List Item added via the Work List Setup page to which the rule is assigned.

item.title: Work List Event Rule - Work List Setup – Plan Task
item.description: Work List Event Rule - Work List Setup – Plan Task Use this page to view Work List Event Rules assigned to Plan Tasks accessed from the *Work List Setup* page. Refer to Register Work List Event Rules for a Work List Item for more information. To access this page: Click Track > Configuration > Work List in the Navigation pane. Click the Rules icon for a Work List Item.

item.title: Work List Event Rules
item.description: Work List Event Rules Use this page to [Register Work List Event Rules to a Plan](../Use_Cases/Register_Work_List_Event_Rules_for_a_Plan). To access this page: Select Track > Project in the *Navigation* pane. Click Plans for a project. Click Rules for a plan. Field Description PLAN TASK ID Displays the task name, if the rule was added at the Plan Task level. PRIORITY

item.title: Work List Event Rules – Tag Registration
item.description: Work List Event Rules – Tag Registration Use this page to [Configure Logic Tags](../Use_Cases/Configure_Logic_Tags). To access this page: Click Track > Configuration > Tag Type in the Navigation pane. Click the Registrations icon for a Logic tag on the Tag - All Types page. Click the Roles icon for a logic tag. Field Description TAG ID Displays the name of the tag to which the rule is assigned.

item.title: Work List Event Validations - Plan Task H
item.description: Work List Event Validations - Plan Task H Work List Event Validations - Plan Task V Use this page to register [Work List Event Validations to Plan Tasks.](../Use_Cases/Register_WorkList_Event_Validations_Plan_Task) To access this page: Select Track >Project in the Navigation pane. Click Plans for a project. Click Tasks for a plan. Click Validations for a task. Field Description PLAN TASK ID Displays the name of the Plan Task associated with the validation if the validation was added at the Plan Task level.

item.title: Work List Event Validations - Tag Registration H
item.description: Work List Event Validations - Tag Registration H Work List Event Validations - Tag Registration V Use this page to [Configure Logic Tags](../Use_Cases/Configure_Logic_Tags). To access this page: Select Track >Configuration > Tag Type in the *Navigation* pane. Click Tags for the Logic Tag Type. Click Registrations for the tag. Click Validations. Field Description TAG ID Displays the name of the tag used to assign the task to the validation.

item.title: Work List Event Validations - Work List Setup H
item.description: Work List Event Validations - Work List Setup H Work List Event Validations - Work List Setup V Use this page to [Register Work List Event Validations for Work List Items](../Use_Cases/Register_WorkList_Event_Valid_WorkList_Item). To access this page: Select Track > Configuration > Work List in the *Navigation* pane. Click Validations for a Work List Item. Field Description WORK LIST ITEM ID Displays the name of Work List Item associated with the validation.

item.title: Work List Event Validations - Work List Setup Task H
item.description: Work List Event Validations - Work List Setup Task H Work List Event Validations - Work List Setup Task V Use this page to view Work List Event Validations assigned to Plan Tasks accessed from the *[Work List Setup](Work_List_Setup_H)* page. Refer to Register Work List Event Validations for Work List Items for more information. To access this page: Select Track >Configuration > Work List in the *Navigation* pane.

item.title: Work List Event Validations H
item.description: Work List Event Validations H Work List Event Validations V Use this page to [Register Work List Event Validations to a Plan](../Use_Cases/Register_WorkList_Event_Validations_Plan). To access this page: Select Track > Project in the *Navigation* pane. Click Plans for a project. Click Validations for a plan. Field Description PLAN TASK ID Displays the name of the Plan Task associated with the validation if the validation was added at the Plan Task level.

item.title: Work List H
item.description: Work List H Work List V Use this page to [Use the Work List.](../Use_Cases/Use_the_Work_List) To access this page, click the blue tab on the Quick Panel to access the Work List. Field Description Work List Detail Click to open the Work List Detail page to view additional information about Plan Tasks and Work List Item on the Work List and to view the tags and users assigned to each item.

item.title: Work List Item User
item.description: Work List Item User Use this page to [Add Users to a Work List Item](../Use_Cases/Add_Users_to_an_Item). To access this page: Select Track >Configuration > Work List from the Navigation pane. Click the Users icon for an item on the *Work List Setup* page. Field Description Add To Work List Item Click to add the selected user to the selected Work List Item.

item.title: Work List Setup H
item.description: Work List Setup H Work List Setup V Use this page to [Add Work List Items](../Use_Cases/Add_Work_List_Items_Overview). To access this page, select Track > Configuration > Work List. Field Description ITEM NAME Displays the name of the Work List Item or Plan Task. STATUS Displays the Plan Task’s or Work List Item’s status. Refer to Task Status for more information.

item.title: Work With Field Groups
item.description: Work With Field Groups Field groups are filters used to create subsets of data in a Target field. Based on values in another related field, these subsets can have different settings, such as criticality, whether the field is required or which rules will run against the field. If, for example, a field is required only under certain data conditions, field groups are used to define the conditions, fields, values, and requirement setting.

item.title: Work With Sources Overview
item.description: Work With Sources Overview Source types in the DSP® are: Add Row Source Update Row Source Full Construction Source External Source An Add Row Source is the Source table where records are migrated from and inserted into the Target table. Records in an Add Row Source table are used for reconciliation. An Add Row Source is added in Target Design. Refer to Assign a Source to a Target for more information.

item.title: Work with Metric Groups
item.description: Work with Metric Groups Metric groups are a subcategory of field groups and provide a way to further organize data for metrics tracking and mapping. The metric groups are defined in Target Design and set for Target Fields in Target Design. Metric groups are displayed on the Field Mappings page in Map and several reports showing progress of the mapping process. Each set of metric groups are delineated into logical sets of fields that relate to a screen within the Target system.

item.title: Work with Objects
item.description: Work with Objects An Object is a grouping of Targets and is used to organize business objects within the data conversion project. Using Console, an object (or multiple objects) is assigned to a context (a combination of a Wave and Process Area). A Target and Source (or multiple Targets and Sources) are then defined for an object in Target Design. Refer to Create the Contexts for Migration Projects for more information.

item.title: Work with Plan Tasks
item.description: Work with Plan Tasks Plan Tasks are imported into dspTrack™ when a project file is imported. Refer to Import Project Files into dspTrack™. Plan Tasks, user assignments to Plan Tasks, and task dependencies can also be added manually. Plan Tasks and Work List Items display on the Work List and Work List Setup page. To differentiate between the two, a Plan Task has a Project and Plan name in the PROJECT and PLAN field on the Work List and Work List Setup page.

item.title: Work with Sources with Multi-part Keys
item.description: Work with Sources with Multi-part Keys Map allows a user to map multiple sources to one target, and to map multiple sources with multi-part keys to a target. The sources are assigned to the target in Target Design. ZLegacy<KeyFieldName> is the key for the target table. Map the keys on the source table to the ZLegacy<KeyFieldName> on the Field Mappings page. If a source has more keys or a different number of keys than the target, add a mapping that uses a Rule action to concatenate key values on the source table into a single target key field beginning with ZLegacy.

item.title: Work with Target Fields
item.description: Work with Target Fields This section contains the following topics: Add Fields to a Target Allow Mapping of Utility Columns Set Field Visibility for Mapping Activate or Deactivate Target Fields for Mapping Set Date, Time, and Decimal Formats

item.title: Work with Targets and Sources
item.description: Work with Targets and Sources This section contains the following topics: Add a Target Assign a Source to a Target View Target and Source Assignments Sync Source Data Source-System Types Across all Targets Set a Target’s Design Status Copy a Target in Target Design Delete a Target Access Targets at the Object Level Add Developers and Business Contacts to a Target or Source Set Target Dependencies Update System Types for a Source Append Utility Columns to All Tables Add Utility Field Defaults

item.title: Work with Work List Items
item.description: Work with Work List Items Work List Items are ad hoc tasks that can be added outside of project and plans. Work List Items are different from Plan Tasks in that Work List Items: Are not assigned to a plan or project Do not have predecessor tasks, and are never in the status Waiting on Dependency Are added on the Work List Setup page Cannot be copied Cannot have tags assigned Only display on the Work List Detail page when the status is Completed Do not have Warn Thresholds applied Do not have a duration or Unit of Measure set Are never included on the Critical Path Are never milestones Work List Items, like Plan Tasks, display on the Work List unless they are in Completed status.

item.title: Workflow
item.description: Workflow Use this page to [Register Workflow Events](../Use_Cases/Register_Workflow_Events). To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the Events icon. Click the Parameters icon for an event with EVENT TYPE of Workflow. Field Description FIELD Displays the field from the workflow view that is passed to the event. When the view is registered to the event, the parameters are automatically created for the event.

item.title: Workflow (Email)
item.description: Workflow (Email) Use this page to [Register Workflow Events](../Use_Cases/Register_Workflow_Events). To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the Events icon for the desired interface. Click Vertical View for an event with EVENT TYPE of Workflow. Click the Fields icon. Field Description Interface ID Displays a system-generated ID to uniquely identify the interface. Event ID Displays a system-generated ID to uniquely identify the event.

item.title: Workflow Download Failures H
item.description: Workflow Download Failures H Workflow Download Failures V Use this page to [View Workflow Download Failures](../Use_Cases/View_Workflow_Download_Failures). To access this page, select Collect > Administrative > Workflow Download Failures in the Navigation pane. Field Description TARGET Displays target database where the download failure occurred. SOURCE Displays source database where the download failure occurred. TABLE Displays table name where the download failure occurred.

item.title: Workflow Language Message H
item.description: Workflow Language Message H Workflow Language Message V Use this page to [Configure Workflow Messages](../Config/Configure_Workflow_Messages.htm) and [Update the EMAIL FROM column.](../Config/Update_the_EMAIL_FROM_Column.htm) To access this page: Select dspCompose > Configuration > Workflow Message in the Navigation pane. Click Messages for a LANGUAGE ID. Field Description EVENT Displays event that triggers the workflow email to be sent. SUBJECT Displays subject line of workflow email.

item.title: Workflow Links
item.description: Workflow Links Use this page to [Register Workflow Events](../Use_Cases/Register_Workflow_Events). To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the Events icon for the desired interface. Click Vertical View for an event with EVENT TYPE of Workflow. Click the Links icon. NOTE: The Links icon is only enabled if the Link to Page ID field is populated. Field Description PRIORITY Displays the order in which the link appears in the workflow (if there are multiple links).

item.title: Workflow Links
item.description: Workflow Links Use this page to [Configure Workflow Links](../Use_Cases/Configure_Workflow_Links.htm). To access this page: Select Admin >WebApps in the Navigation pane. Click Pages for a WEB APP NAME. Click Events for a DESCRIPTION. Click Business Rules for an EVENT. Click Vertical View for a business rule with a PROCEDURE TYPE of Workflow. Click Workflow Links button. Field Description LINK Displays the link text that appears in the workflow.

item.title: Workflow Log
item.description: Workflow Log Use this page to [View Work Flow Messages Sent](../Use_Cases/View_Workflow_Messages_Sent). To access this page, select Track > Configuration > Work Flow > Work Flow Log. Field Description Acknowledge Work Flows Click to clear all records from the WorkFlow log. This action cannot be undone. SUBJECT Displays the subject of the workflow email that was sent. dspTrack™ includes a standard set of subject text that cannot be updated.

item.title: Workflow Log H
item.description: Workflow Log H Workflow Log V Use this page to [View the Workflow Log](../Use_Cases/View%20the%20Workflow%20Log.htm). To access this page, select Admin > Resources > Workflow Log. Field Description SUBJECT Displays the subject of the email. TO RECIPIENTS Displays the email address of the user who received the email, if the email was sent successfully. ISSUED DATE Displays the date and time the email was sent.

item.title: Workflow Message
item.description: Workflow Message Use this page to [Configure Workflow Messages](../Config/Configure_Workflow_Messages.htm). To access this page, select dspCompose > Configuration > Workflow Message in the Navigation pane. Field Description LANGUAGE ID Displays language used for the workflow message. Language-specific messages are added on the Workflow Message page and the Workflow Language Message page. NOTE: Workflow messages can be configured for the languages that display in the LANGUAGE ID column.

item.title: Workflow Message Defaults
item.description: Workflow Message Defaults Use this page to[View Default Workflow Messages](../Config/View_Default_Workflow_Messages). To access this page, select dspConduct > Configuration > Messaging in the Navigation pane. Field Description EVENT Displays the event that triggers the workflow email to be sent. NOTE: The name must be unique to the category. The Event name cannot be updated for default events. SUBJECT Displays the subject line of the workflow email.

item.title: Workflow Message Summary H
item.description: Workflow Message Summary H Workflow Message Summary V Use this page to [Create Custom Workflow Messages](../Use_Cases/Create_Custom_Workflow_Messages). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane, or select Console in the Context bar. Select Advanced Configuration > Workflow Message Summary in the Navigation pane. Field Description WORKFLOW NAME Displays the name of workflow to be processed.

item.title: Workflow Message Summary User
item.description: Workflow Message Summary User Use this page to: - [Add Users to Workflow Messages](../Use_Cases/Create_Custom_Workflow_Messages#Add) - [Set up Workflow Message Summary Users](../../Map/Config/Setup_User_Notifications#Set_up_Workflow_Message_Summary_Users) To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane, or select Console in the Context bar. Select Advanced Configuration > Workflow Message Summary in the Navigation pane. Click the Users icon for the workflow name. Field Description USER ID Displays the name of the user who will receive the message.

item.title: Workflow Overview
item.description: Workflow Overview Workflow is an email notification method called from within a WebApp where an email is sent upon the execution of an event. If a workflow requires a user to log in to the platform in order to perform a function, a link can be included in the email to navigate directly to the relevant page in the WebApp. Workflow is used in situations where groups, users and fields outside the context of a particular page are needed, or when the decisions to manually send an email are particularly complex.

item.title: Workflow Summary History H
item.description: Workflow Summary History H Workflow Summary History V Use this page to review who is receiving workflow emails. To access this page, select Collect > Administrative > Workflow Summary History in the Navigation pane. Field Description USER NAME Displays user who received the summary workflow email. WORKFLOWED BY Displays name of job that ran the workflow.

item.title: Workflow Summary User Settings
item.description: Workflow Summary User Settings Use this page to [Configure Workflow Summary User Settings](../Use_Cases/Configure_Workflow_Summary_User_Settings). To access this page, select Collect > Administrative > Workflow Summary User Settings in the Navigation pane. Field Description TARGET Displays target database for which summary workflow emails are sent to the user. USER NAME Displays user who received the summary workflow email. WORK FLOW SUMMARY

item.title: Workflow Summary Views H
item.description: Workflow Summary Views H Workflow Summary Views V Use this page to [Register Workflow Views](../Use_Cases/Create_Custom_Workflow_Messages#Register). To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane, or select Console in the Context bar. Select Advanced Configuration > Workflow Message Summary in the Navigation pane. Click the Views icon for the workflow name. Field Description PRIORITY Displays the order in which the rule is run.

item.title: Workflow Template
item.description: Workflow Template Use this page to [Configure Subject and Body of the Report Readiness Notification.](../Use_Cases/Configure_Notifications_for_Report_Readiness.htm#Configure_Subject_and_Body_of_the_Notification) To access this page in Transform: Click the Objects icon on the *Process Area Launch* page. Click the Report Readiness Notification icon for an Object. Click the Workflow Template icon on the Page toolbar. Field Description Reset Workflow Template to Default Click to reset any customizations made to the workflow subject and body back to their shipped defaults.

item.title: Workflow User Preference
item.description: Workflow User Preference Use this page to [Set User Workflow Receipt Preferences](../Use_Cases/Set_User_Workflow_Receipt_Preferences). To access this page click Track > Configuration > Workflow > User Preferences. Field Description User ID Displays the name of the logged in user who will receive the workflow message in dspTrack™. NOTE: A user can only set preferences for that user’s account. Message Type ID Displays how the user receives workflow messages from dspTrack™.

item.title: Xref
item.description: Xref The Xref action is used when mapping a field that must use value mapping. NOTE: The Xref action requires a check table to be defined for the field. If a check table is not already defined for the field, update the System Type for this field to add a check table. Refer to Add Check Tables in the Common documentation. NOTE: The RuleXref action must be used with a lookup table that has multiple key fields.

item.title: Your Application Table Column Reports H
item.description: Your Application Table Column Reports H NOTE: When a user accesses this page in the Navigation pane, the fields below display. When a user clicks the View icon on this page to view report data, the report title still displays as the page name even though columns that display depend on the columns on the generated report. In this case, the page displays the report’s columns only and not the fields below.

item.title: Your Application Table Columns
item.description: Your Application Table Columns Use this page to [View Your Application Table Columns](../Use_Cases/View_Your_Application_Table_Columns). To access this page: Select dspMonitor > Your Applications in the Navigation pane. Click the Tables icon. Click the Columns icon. Field Description TABLE NAME Display the name of the table. COLUMN NAME Displays the name of the column. SIGMA LEVEL Displays the sigma level based on data quality score calculations.

item.title: Your Application Table Reports H
item.description: Your Application Table Reports H NOTE: When a user accesses this page in the Navigation pane, the fields below display. When a user clicks the View icon on this page to view report data, the report title still displays as the page name even though columns that display depend on the columns on the generated report. In this case, the page displays the report’s columns only and not the fields below.

item.title: Your Application Tables H
item.description: Your Application Tables H Your Application Tables V Use this page to: - [View Your Application Tables](../Use_Cases/View_Your_Application_Tables) - [Profile a Target Table in dspMonitor](../Use_Cases/Profile_a_Target_Table_in_dspMonitor) To access this page: Select dspMonitor > Your Applications in *Navigation* pane. Click the Tables icon. Field Description APPLICATION Displays the name of the application. TABLE NAME Displays the name of the table.

item.title: Your Applications
item.description: Your Applications Use this page to [View Your Applications](../Use_Cases/View_Your_Applications). To access this page, select dspMonitor > Your Applications in the Navigation pane. Field Description APPLICATION Displays the name of the application. SIGMA LEVEL Displays the sigma level based on data quality score calculations. The Enable Sigma Level checkbox on the Parameters page must be checked for this field to display.

item.title: Your Dashboard Reports
item.description: Your Dashboard Reports To access this page: Select dspMonitor > Dashboard > User (Errors) in *Navigation* pane. Click the Reports icon. Field Description REPORT Displays name of report as it appears in the report repository. DATE TIME Displays date and time when the report was last processed. RECORD COUNT Displays number of records in report when the report was last processed.

item.title: Your Favorite Reports H
item.description: Your Favorite Reports H NOTE: When a user accesses this page in the Navigation pane, the fields below display. When a user clicks the View icon on this page to view report data, the report title still displays as the page name even though columns that display depend on the columns on the generated report. In this case, the page displays the report’s columns only and not the fields below.

item.title: Your Filters
item.description: Your Filters Use this page to [View Your Filters](../Use_Cases/View_Your_Filters). To access this page select dspMonitor > Your Filters in *Navigation* pane. Field Description FIELD Displays field that is filtered. OPERATOR Displays operator used to filter field by the CONSTANT. CONSTANT Displays value compared to field using the OPERATOR.

item.title: Your Group Reports H
item.description: Your Group Reports H NOTE: When a user accesses this page in the Navigation pane, the fields below display. When a user clicks the View icon on this page to view report data, the report title still displays as the page name even though columns that display depend on the columns on the generated report. In this case, the page displays the report’s columns only and not the fields below.

item.title: Your Groups H
item.description: Your Groups H Your Groups V Use this page to: - [Manually Process Group Reports](../Use_Cases/Process_Reports#Manually_Process_Group_Reports) - [View Your Groups](../Use_Cases/View_Your_Groups) To access this page, select dspMonitor > Your Groups in *Navigation* pane. Field Description Process Click to process your reports within the group. Process For All Users Click to process all the reports within the group for all users who have access to the reports.

item.title: Your Metrics
item.description: Your Metrics Use this page to view report metrics for Your Group Reports, Your Favorite Reports, Your Application Table Reports, and Your Application Table Column Reports. To access this page: Select dspMonitor > Your Groups in Navigation pane. Click the Favorites or Reports icon. Click the Metrics icon. Or Select dspMonitor > Your Applications in Navigation pane. Click Tables icon. Click Reports icon. Click the Metrics icon.

item.title: Your Object Reports H
item.description: Your Object Reports H NOTE: When a user accesses this page in the Navigation pane, the fields below display. When a user clicks the View icon on this page to view report data, the report title still displays as the page name even though columns that display depend on the columns on the generated report. In this case, the page displays the report’s columns only and not the fields below.

item.title: Your Objects H
item.description: Your Objects H Your Objects V Use this page to [View Your Objects](../Use_Cases/View_Your_Objects). To access this page, select dspMonitor > Your Objects in the Navigation pane. Field Description OBJECT NAME Displays the object name. DESCRIPTION Displays a description on the object. SIGMA LEVEL Displays the sigma level based on data quality score calculations. The Enable Sigma Level checkbox on the Parameters page must be checked for this field to display.

item.title: ZSource
item.description: ZSource Use this page to [Set up ZSources.](../Config/Set_up_ZSources) To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Construct in the Context bar. Click ZSource in the Navigation pane. Field Description Z SOURCE Displays name of Source where data is being created. Users Click to open the ZSourceUser page to manage users who can create data for the Source.

item.title: ZSourceUser
item.description: ZSourceUser Use this page to [Set up ZSources.](../Config/Set_up_ZSources) To access this page: Select dspMigrate in the Navigation pane. Select Construct in the Context bar. Click ZSource in the Navigation pane. Click the Users icon for the ZSource. Field Description Z SOURCE Displays name of Source where data is being created. USER NAME Displays name of user permitted to create data for the Source.

item.title: dspCompose Requests H
item.description: dspCompose Requests H dspCompose Requests V [View Your Active Requests Details.](../Use_Cases/View_Your_Active_Requests_Details.htm) To access this page, click the black dspCompose Requests tab in the Quick Panel. Field Description Requests Click to open the Request page to view additional request details and access functionality related to org units and external role contacts for all requests. REQUEST ID Displays unique number that identifies the request.

item.title: dspConduct Task H
item.description: dspConduct Task H dspConduct Task V Use this page to [View dspConduct Pages that are Assigned to Roles](../Use_Cases/View_a_Roles_dspConduct_Pages). To access this page select dspConduct > Configuration > Setup > dspConduct Task in the Navigation pane. Field Description TASK ID Displays the name of the task. Refer to Add a Task in dspConduct™ for more information. TYPE Displays the task type.

item.title: dspConduct™ Design Process Overview
item.description: dspConduct™ Design Process Overview A governance hierarchy consists of the following elements: A category - collection of the tasks, roles, scenarios and business process created to organize the elements by, for example, line of business, business unit or division, or data domain. Business processes – A collection of scenarios to allow a series of linked scenarios to be created. Scenarios - A collection of roles that outlines a single process, such as creating a new FinishedGood.

item.title: dspMigrate™ Advanced Data Migration (ADM) Overview
item.description: dspMigrate™ Advanced Data Migration (ADM) Overview The Data Stewardship Platform® (DSP)® delivers the core data quality, data migration and information governance functionality. An application suite of the DSP is dspMigrate™Advanced Data Migration (ADM). Console Console is the single point for the management and administration for dspMigrate™ Advanced Data Migration (ADM). Target Design Design is a component of dspMigrate™ Advanced Data Migration (ADM) used to document tables, fields and sources used in migration projects.

item.title: dspMonitor™ Construction
item.description: dspMonitor™ Construction dspMonitor™ Construction provides the ability to rapidly create and maintain a web-based user interface to manage cross-reference table(s) and to control parameters dynamically within the application rather than hard code those values within the code of the report. The report is built once. If the report requires updates (for example, if parameters change or values need to be added), a business user does not need a developer to change the underlying code of the report.

item.title: dspTrack™ and MSProject Integration
item.description: dspTrack™ and MSProject Integration dspTrack™ is a task execution tool and should be used to monitor tasks as they move through a workflow. It should not be used as a project management tool. Updates to project data should be maintained in MSProject or Microsoft Excel. To update project data for a dspTrack™ plan: Export the data from dspTrack™ Import the data into MSProject. Update the data in MSProject
